## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been wondering, what's the main focus of the Verus community? Is it more about convincing people of its capabilities or creating new features?

**AI Assistant:**
The main focus of the Verus community is creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. The community has put its energy into developing new capabilities and features, rather than spending time trying to convince others of their potential. It's all about building and innovating, rather than just talking about what's possible.

**User:**
That's great to hear. I've also been wondering, are Verus identities centralized and controlled by a single entity? I want to make sure I understand how they work.

**AI Assistant:**
No, Verus identities (VerusID) are not centralized and are not controlled by a single entity. They are self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable, enabling permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are fully under the control of the individual. You have complete control over your VerusID, and no one else can dictate what you do with it.

**User:**
That's really reassuring. I've heard of Verus Vault, what's that all about? Is it a feature that allows for instant withdrawal of funds at any time?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, no, Verus Vault is a staking-capable time-locking and theft prevention feature that enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. This feature is designed to prevent theft and provides a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, and identity theft. It's a security feature that helps protect your assets, rather than a feature for quick withdrawals.
What's the main focus of the Verus community, convincing people of its capabilities or creating new features?

The main focus of the Verus community is creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. The community has put its energy into developing new capabilities and features, rather than spending time trying to convince others of their potential.

As Verus PBaaS offers completely new capabilities that go beyond today’s decentralized platforms in many fundamental ways, the worldwide Verus community put its energy into creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. Members across the Verus worldwide community have worked hard to make this all possible, and we are more than excited that you can now experience it firsthand. If you have an interest in the future of crypto, you owe it to yourself to learn about Verus, an unlimited scale, decentralized future with truth and privacy for all.### The Verus testnet, available in the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, has the following capabilities, which to our knowledge are unique in crypto today.### Self sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (currently on mainnet) VerusID
- Enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.
## Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
- Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. IDs may be used as friendly name cryptocurrency addresses for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network. The VerusID protocol is a protocol, which can also be impleme
